question: Among the following, the most sensitive antenatal USG finding of Trisomy 21 is:
exp: Prenatal USG markers of Down syndrome- Thickness of nuchal fold (75% sensitive) Absence of nasal bone (58% sensitive) cardiac abnormalities, duodenal atresia, shoened femur, shoened humerus, echogenic bowel

question: A 2 yr old boy presents with sho stature, cryptorchidism and congenital heart disease. On examination, the child was also found to have absent nails and polydactyly. Likely diagnosis is:
exp: Syndrome Features Ellis-van Creveld syndrome Also called 'chondroectodermal dysplasia' Chondrodystrophy, polydactyly, ectodermal dysplasia, CHD (Single atrium, VSD). Genitourinary anomalies -hypospadias, epispadias, hypoplastic penis, cryptorchidism, vulvar atresia Rubinstein- Taybi syndrome Microcephaly, ptosis, beaked nose with low-lying philtrum, Broad thumbs and large toes, Intellectual disability, VSD Turner syndrome Only in females; Webbed neck, sho stature, Lymphedema of hand & feet Impaired feility seen Edward syndrome VSD, ASD, PDA, coarctation of aoa, bicuspid aoic or pulmonary valve

question: Turner syndrome is most commonly associated with which of the following?
exp: Most common heart disease in Turner syndrome is Bicuspid aoic valve, followed by coarctation of aoa

question: Not seen in William syndrome?
exp: William's syndrome- Supravalvular aoic stenosis Intellectual disability Sho stature Hypercalcemia and hypertension Face of a child with 'elfin facies' -small upturned nose, long philtrum, wide mouth, full cheeks, full lips, small chin, and puffiness around the eyes.

question: Child with bouts of laughter, what should be the possible diagnosis?
exp: ANGELMAN SYNDROM/Happy puppet syndrome Bouts of laughter, intellectual disability, cerebella ataxia and severe developmental delay, Malformations of the skull and facial bones, seizures RUSSELL SILVER SYNDROME - Sho stature, Triangular facies PRADER WILLI SYNDROME - Obesity, Feeding difficulty, Intellectual disabilities FRAGILE X SYNDROME as- XL dominant, Elongated face, large ears, large testis

question: Which of the following is not a usual feature of Noonan syndrome
exp: Noonan syndrome - pubey is delayed but feility is normal

question: Which among the following is the most common chromosomal anomaly encountered in spontaneously aboed foetuses?
exp: Among the spontaneously aboed foetuses, autosomal trisomies are the most common chromosomal caus. Within this category, trisomy 16 is the most frequent The recurrence risk of trisomy 16 is negligible in subsequent pregnancies

question: A 12-year-child, who has intellectual disability, is having large face, large jaw, large ear and macroorchidism. Diagnosis?
exp: Fragile X syndrome- CGG trinucleotide repeats. Intellectual disability, large face, large jaw, large ear and macro-orchidism. Cri-du chat syndrome- high pitched cry, microcephaly, intellectual disability, hypotonia Mc Cune Albright syndrome- cafe au lait pigmentation, fibrous dysplasia, endocrine dysfunction Down's syndrome- mongloid slant, epicanthal folds, depressed nasal bridge

question: Which of the following hormones are raised in Prader. Willi syndrome?
exp: Prader-Willi syndrome: Due to silencing of paternal copy of UBE 3A gene on chr 15 C/F- obesity- | Ghrelin Sho stature Intellectual disability Hypotonia Hypogonadism

question: Most common chromosomal syndrome in children is?
exp: **Down syndrome (Trisomy 21) is the most common of the chromosomal disorder. **Trisomy 16 is the most common trisomy overall, however most do not survive and die in utero Hence, among the live bihs, or among children, most common chromosomal abnormality is Trisomy 21
